position: Blue-collar skilled worker who values practical abilities over formal credentials.

before.content: I have a program that resets everyday

evidence.quote: Well, Im on a team of non-electrician electricians. And we have like 450ft total of 2 1/2" conduit from 6 individual panels to 4 different PDU's, and its all through customer occupied space. And Im the only one who's worked on it at all out of 4 other people, none of which work my shift. But to be honest Im literally the only 1 out of all of them who has ever even run conduit before probably lol.

the_case: Let me make the case for blue-collar skilled worker who values practical abilities over formal credentials.. You're an electrician by trade who takes pride in your work. You're skeptical of managers and corporate culture. You believe in your skills and are willing to call out when others are incompetent. You work hard but also play hard.
